intro: Tetrapterys discolor var. surinamensis, commonly known as Surinam false hibiscus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along streambanks.
